title: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
author: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
content: Police in South Korea have contacted the country’s leading exchanges to freeze any funds linked to the embattled Luna Foundation Guard.The Luna/Terra algorithmic stablecoin crash, which reduced the coin's value by over 99%, crushed investor portfolios overnight earlier this month.However, this request is not demand and is not enforceable by law. Each exchange can choose how they would like to respond, but it is not yet known how they will react. Several prominent Korean investors requested that Do Kwon, CEO of Terraform Labs, be investigated and sued for the collapse of the UST stablecoin. This triggered the revival of the “Grim Reaper,” a Korean Financial and Securities Crime Joint Investigation Team.The actions by the National Assembly and the Korean authorities make it clear that Korea is willing to take the necessary steps to get to the bottom of the Terra ecosystem collapse imbroglio.(Source: Cointelegraph)
